This expense report cannot be submitted until all exceptions with red flags are resolved. To view the report-level exceptions, click the Report Header link. To view the entry-level exceptions, click the expense type (link) associated with the flag. To view the exceptions associated with itemized expenses, click the View Itemization link associated with the flag.
This expense report cannot be submitted until all exceptions with red flags are resolved.
The expense report contains one or more expenses with an expense type of Undefined. You must select an expense type for each expense before you can submit the report.
At least one required field in this report lacks data. A red exception flag marks the expense and a list identifies the field(s) to be filled out. Please provide a value and then submit the report.

At least one required allocation field in this report lacks data. A red exception flag marks each affected expense.Â Please, open the allocations for each affected expense, provide the appropriate value, and then submit the report.
This report contains a Lodging expense that is not itemized. Lodging expenses must be itemized in the report before it can be submitted.
The expense report contains at least one itemized expense. The sum of itemizations do not match the expense total. Edit the itemized entries to make the required changes before submitting the report.
This report cannot be submitted because one or more entries must be itemized. Itemize the entries and then submit the report.
The report has already been submitted and cannot be submitted again.
The report cannot be submitted by the Delegate.
Cash Advances must be entirely utilized or returned. Please enter a Cash Advance Return on this report to return the remaining balance.

The Cash Advance Balance is negative because a Cash Advance Return is greater than the remaining balance. Either enter a Currency Gain/Loss expense to bring the balance to zero or adjust the Cash Advance Return amount to bring the balance to zero. Then, click Submit again.
This report contains at least one itinerary with a single itinerary row. An itinerary is not valid until it has at least two rows. Please add another row to complete the itinerary.
This report contains at least one entry with an attendee of an invalid type. Please remove the attendee(s) before submitting the report.

On %date% the bank information we use to process your expense reimbursements was changed to "%changed_data%". If you made this change then no action is required. If you didn't make this change you should login to Concur and confirm that your bank information is correct.

On %date% the email address was changed from %old_address% to %new_address%. If you made this change then no action is required. If you didn't make this change you should login to the Expense service and confirm that your email address is correct.
This is the daily pre-funding account notification for account %account_name% for %current_date%

The failure rate for the anomaly data checks executed on %date% was %failure_rate%, exceeding the configured threshold of %configured_rate%. The following data checks identified anomalies and should be reviewed.
Refer to the Anomaly reports in Intelligence for more information.
We were not able to read the receipt details for the receipt sent.

This could happen because of several reasons such as
the picture is too blurry
the text is not legible
there are receipts submitted for multiple expenses in the same document
Please review the receipt and submit it again after you review it.

We found multiple receipts on the receipt image sent.
We can only process one receipt in an image.
Please send each receipt in its own image.

To update an existing list, select the list name from the list below. To import a new list, click New List.
Before uploading data, you must either select an existing list, or click New List to enter a name for the list.
You must enter a List Name in the List Name field above.

The imported list items will either be added in the case of new items or updated for existing items. The system uses the list item code to determine whether the item is new or existing.

The list import requires Microsoft Excel and a list import template formatted to the list import specification.

To download an list import template:
1. Click on this link.
2. Select the appropriate menu option to save the file to your computer.
3. Open the file using Microsoft Excel.
4. You can use this template to either enter data to be imported or as a guide for how to format data to be imported.

To upload a list import spreadsheet:
1. Click Browse.
2. Locate the list import file and click Open to select it.
3. Click .
The file wasn't processed because it contains one or more errors with its formatting that prevents the system from processing it. These errors are listed below.

The results of the Field Validation are:

list items were successfully processed.
list items failed field validation.
These list items appear in the table below and were not imported.
Error add a list in Expense db.
Error get a list info in Expense db.
Error creating a job run in Expense db to import list items.
The import file contains the column '', position with a field name of ''. Vendor list can only have one level, please remove columns for additional levels from the import file.
The file is missing the column ''. The file must have this column and include a value for each list item.
The column '', position contains an Unknown Field: . The column names must match the column names specified in the List Import Template specification.
The column '', position with a field name of '' is not in the correct order. The columns must match the column order specified in the List Import Template specification.

There are missing list levels in your list's hierarchy. In a multiple level list you must sequence the rows by level beginning with Level 1 including a row for each item at this level followed by Level 2 including a row for each item at this level and so on until you have included all levels in your list. Consult the List Import User Guide for details.
The value for 'Delete?' column should be either 'Y' or 'N' or left blank.

The value is missing for ''. In a multiple level list each list item must have values for all the Level Codes for all the levels above the item in the list's hierarchy. Consult the List Import User Guide for details.
The value for '' is not in the list. In a multiple level list all the items in the hierarchy that are above this list item must be in the list. Consult the List Import User Guide for details.
The value for Item Name has more than 64 characters. Names must have fewer than 65 characters.
The value for '' has more than 32 characters. Item Codes must have fewer than 33 characters.
List item not processed because its parent list item does not exist in the hierarchy.
Identify the missing parent node and add an item to the file for this missing item. Re-import the file.
Duplicate list import records were provided for category , list for the following list item code(s): . The last duplicate imported was kept and the rest were deleted.

Review the file to find the rows with list items that use this list code. Decide what row represents the list item you want to use and leave this row in the file. Remove the other rows from the file. Re-import the file.
List item was in use by the hierarchy. Deleting this list item may result in some employees being assigned to an inactive group.
Run an employee import with updated list item values to reassign employees to valid groups.
List item was used for configuration of for record , and this configuration has been marked inactive.
Notify the configuration administrator that this change to configuration was made during the list import.
The file contains more than 1,000 list items. To import more than 1,000 list items, you can create and import multiple files where each files has no more than 1,000 list items in it.
Reduce the number of list items in the file. Re-import the file.
There are cells with a data format other than Text. All cells in spreadsheet with list items data must have a data format of Text.
Change the format of all cells in the Excel spreadsheet to Text. Re-import the file.

The imported expense types will either be added in the case of new expense types, or updated in the case of existing expense types. The system uses the Expense Type Name to determine whether the item is new or existing.

The expense type import requires Microsoft Excel and an expense type import spreadsheet formatted to the Expense Type Import specification.

To download an expense type import template:
1. Click on this link.
2. Select the appropriate menu option to save the file to your computer.
3. Open the file using Microsoft Excel.
You can use this template to either enter data to be imported or as a guide for how to format your import spreadsheet.
Refer to the User Guide for detailed information on how to populate the spreadsheet.

To upload an expense type import spreadsheet:
1. Click Browse.
2. Locate the expense type import spreadsheet on your computer.
3. Click Open.
4. Click .
The ledger name, , in the Ledger field isn't recognized.
Correct the Ledger value and re-import the file.
The policy name, , in the Policy field isn't recognized.
Correct the Policy value and re-import the file.
The expense type has multiple records for policy and ledger . For each combination of policy and ledger there can be only one expense type entry for a given expense type name.
Review your file and identify the duplicate entries. Keep the desired one and discard the others so there is only one entry per combination of policy and ledger. Once corrected, re-import the file.
Please verify and re import again.
The expense type , policy and ledger has been imported successfully.
The expense type has been deleted and can no longer be updated.
To re-add this expense type, create it as a new custom expense type.
Failed to import expense type: missing expense type.
Failed to import expense type: expense type name already in use.
You must choose a unique expense type name.
Failed to import expense type. Stack Trace:
Review the stack trace for error details and contact the appropriate Concur group for resolution.
The entry form name, , in the Entry Form field isn't recognized.
Correct the Entry Form value and re-import the file.
The expense type name, , in the Default Expense Type Name field isn't recognized.
Correct the Default Expense Type Name value and re-import the file.
The expense type name, , in the Default Parent Expense Type Name field isn't recognized.
Correct the Parent Default Expense Type Name value and re-import the file.
Activate must be either Y or N. Correct the value in the Activate field and re-import the file.
The value for Expense Type Name has more than 64 characters. Expense Type Names must have fewer than 65 characters.
The value for Preferred Parent Expense Type Name has more than 64 characters. Preferred Parent Expense Type Names must have fewer than 65 characters.
The value for Account Code has more than 20 characters. Account Codes must have fewer than 21 characters. Correct the Account Code value and re-import the file.
The value for Account Code has more than 48 characters. Account Codes must have fewer than 49 characters. Correct the Account Code value and re-import the file.
The value is missing for expense type name. Either preferred expense type name or default expense type name must be specified.
The value for Commodity Code has more than 8 characters. Commodity Codes should be always be 8 characters. Correct the Commodity Code value and re-import the file.
The value for Commodity Code is less than 8 characters. Commodity Codes should be always be 8 characters. Correct the Commodity Code value and re-import the file.

The value in the Policy field is not in the correct format. This value must be a comma separated list of policy names. If any policy names contain commas, they must be enclosed in double quotation marks: "Standard, US".
Invoice Processing Expense Type Import specification

UserMessages.UserMessage: A special message for our Expense Administrators:

We believe our users are some of the best experts on our products, and their recommendations are hugely valuable to us. Feedback from all of our users about Concur products is very important and helps to make the user experience a better one for everyone.

You can help us by enabling the end user feedback feature for your users (screenshot below). This feedback survey is part of the current Report Totals screen and it is not mandatory for your users to provide feedback.
Would you like to activate end user feedback for your users?

Welcome
to the Available Receipts library!

The file you specified is not a valid localization import file. Verify the file location and try again.
The import file doesn't specify a target language. Make sure the file is a valid localization import file.
Strings listed on the following lines were not updated due to errors
Strings listed on the following lines were not updated due to language mismatches
The system couldn't find any items to import. Please ensure the import file is valid.
Left side of equals sign (=) must be of the form: xx.xx.xx.xx.xx=
Text is too long, limit is %maxlength%.
Number of strings not updated due to errors
Number of strings not updated due to language mismatches
Some strings not updated due to language mismatches
The localization file import failed. The import file must be one that was exported for localization. Ensure that the file you are trying to import is that file.
This file contains the strings to be localized.
The source language and target language are specified below.
There may be lines starting with TableJoin; do not modify these lines.
The lines following that contain the actual strings in the source language.
Modify only the strings that are on the right side of the equals (=) symbol.
When there is a variable in the text string where the program will insert a value at the
time the string is used, it is represented by a label surrounded by percent signs. Example: (Error evaluating rule: %rulename%).
The first number in the string left of (=) indicates the maximum permissible length of the translated string.
Example: For the line 64.CT_EXPENSE_TYPE_LANG.NAME.EXP_KEY.'AIRFR'=Airfare, the translated string should not be more than 64 characters
The second and third part of the string indicate the table name and column name in the database.
In the above example, accordingly, it means that the expense type name needs to be translated.
Important notes for lines starting with "Overwrite" and "Hide Language Mismatch Detail":
These lines control how the localized strings are imported and should not be modified by the translators.
For customers wanting to overwrite any language mismatches that may occur when the database contains customized language strings,
the "Overwrite" flag should be set to "Y".
For customers wanting to hide the display of language mismatch detail encountered when a localized string in the database does not
match the localized string on the import file, the "Hide Language Mismatch Detail" flag should be set to "Y".
If the "Overwrite" flag is "Y", the import will not check for language mismatches.

Address
Date of Birth
Country of Origin

Dear Program Manager,
An expense reimbursement submitted by one of your company's employees was suspended by our bank because an individual with a similar name is listed on a government security screening list.
Transactions suspended due to government security screening require additional information to complete.
We have emailed the traveler to request that they update their Concur profile with this information
Once the traveler updates their profile, the bank will complete the expense reimbursement transaction within three business days and future transactions to this traveler will follow the normal payment cycle

Use this page to define your quarterly budget amounts. These amounts are used in Concur Insight Premium for budget comparison reports
and dashboards.
Note that the fields below represent calendar quarters, not fiscal quarters.

Use this page to specify your quarterly budget amounts in the reporting currency. These amounts are used for budget comparisons in reports and dashboards.

Receive follow-up alerts weekly until the end of the calendar quarter
The Spend Summary email compares the current quarter's spend to prior quarter, and highlights the top 5 spenders.

Select this check box to receive an email alert when a credit card transaction is equal to or greater than a defined amount or is of a certain merchant category. If your company requires this alert for all BI Managers, you cannot decline this alert, but you can change the amount.

By clicking on the 'Accept & Submit' button, I certify that:

  1. This is a true and accurate accounting of expenses incurred to accomplish official business for the Company and there are no expenses claimed as reimbursable which relate to personal or unallowable expenses.
  2. All required receipt images have been attached to this report.
  3. I have not received, nor will I receive, reimbursement from any other source(s) for the expenses claimed.
  4. In the event of overpayment or if payment is received from another source for any portion of the expenses claimed I assume responsibility for repaying the Company in full for those expenses.
